title: Back after 3 years, worried about gaps
context: Composite of professionals returning after extended caregiving who feared CV gaps would erase prior leadership.
session_flow: Sketched a "first week back" simulation to surface transferable strengths and confidence triggers.
Rewrote key CV bullets using challenge-action-result language that honoured the caregiving period.
Role-played conversations for naming boundaries and asking for context without apologising.
boundary_and_consent: Set a rule that we would only reference family details at the depth they authorised before each exercise.
timeframe: 7 sessions over 12 weeks with two async reviews of applications.
shift: They could articulate break learnings without shrinking past achievements and sent outreach messages sooner.
outcome: Entered interviews with language that acknowledged the gap while reinforcing leadership identity.
disclaimer: Composite illustration; experiences will differ per person.
